metadata.title: CVE-2016-10229 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
udp.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5 allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code via UDP traffic that triggers an unsafe second checksumcalculation during execution of a recv system call with the MSG_PEEK flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-79-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-lowlatency - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-79-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-49-generic - 3.19.0-49.55~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-49-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-49.55~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-49-lowlatency - 3.19.0-49.55~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-79.123').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
